findings.title: Unencrypted Private Data On-Chain
findings.description: Access to Critical Private Variable via Public Method

findings.title: Message call with hardcoded gas amount
findings.description: Hardcoded gas amounts can lead to unexpected behavior and potential security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Hash Collisions with Multiple Variable Length Arguments
findings.description: This finding indicates a potential vulnerability where hash collisions can occur due to multiple variable length arguments, which may lead to authentication bypass via capture-replay attacks.

findings.title: Presence of unused variables
findings.description: Unused variables are present in the contract.

findings.title: Right-To Left Override control character (U+202E)
findings.description: The Right-To-Left Override control character (U+202E) can manipulate the visual representation of text, potentially leading to phishing attacks or other security issues.

findings.title: DoS With Block Gas Limit
findings.description: The contract is vulnerable to Denial of Service (DoS) attacks due to uncontrolled resource consumption related to block gas limit.

findings.title: Arbitrary Jump with Function Type Variable
findings.description: The finding indicates a vulnerability where an arbitrary jump can occur due to the use of a function type variable, potentially leading to unintended code execution.

findings.title: Incorrect Inheritance Order
findings.description: The inheritance order of contracts is incorrect, which can lead to unexpected behavior and security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Requirement Violation
findings.description: Improper Following of Specification by Caller

findings.title: Lack of Proper Signature Verification
findings.description: Improper verification of cryptographic signature leading to potential signature replay attacks.
